name: 羅元隆
objective: This course bridges the learning subjects in the undergraduate courses and the future subjects in graduate courses. The content is focused on an SDOF system's governing equation. Students will review what they’ve already learned in their first three years and learn two approaches to dynamic analysis. The main content includes reviews of solutions to 2nd order differential equations, problem statements, free vibration, response to harmonic and periodic excitations, response to arbitrary, step, and pulse excitations, numerical evaluation of dynamic response, and estimation of earthquake responses of a linear system.
schedule:
W01: Derivation and solutions of 2nd order ODEs
W02: Static analysis of trusses, beams, and frames
W03: Equation of motion, problem statement, and solution methods
W04: Free vibration
W05: Free vibration
W06: Response to harmonic and periodic excitations
W07: Response to harmonic and periodic excitations
W08: Mid-term Exam (Written Test)
W09: Response to arbitrary step and pulse excitations
W10: Response to arbitrary step and pulse excitations
W11: Response to arbitrary step and pulse excitations
W12: Numerical evaluation of dynamic response
W13: Numerical evaluation of dynamic response
W14: Numerical evaluation of dynamic response (MATLAB programming)
W15: Earthquake response of linear systems
W16: Earthquake response of linear systems
W17: Final Exam (Written Test)
W18: Report submission
scorePolicy:
Attendance: 15%
Mid-term Exam: 30%
Final Exam: 30%
Report: 25%
materials: Dynamics of Structures – Theory and Applications to Earthquake Engineering 4th ed by Anil K. Chopra
